"If a controller is used to play this game, the keyboard
will still be used for chat and as such, other controls
will be available as well.

These settings can be changed at any time by
selecting [Reset to Defaults] from the Options menu.

Which device would you like to use?"

"You can switch between different button types:
- 2-Button Type (default)
- 3-Button Type

With 3-Button Type, you'll have more PA/Tech slots than the normal 2-Button Type.
You can change this setting anytime from within
the options, under \"Control Settings\"

Which button type would you like to use?"
"A problem was detected with the assignment of vital buttons, such as \"Confirm\" or \"Cancel\". This has been automatically repaired."

"Select how Lock-On functions.
Determine whether to Lock-On by clicking the button once, or holding the button."
"When enabled, the Lock-On target will be changed using <%RStick>."

"Sets how to switch to the back palette.
Choose between switching the palette on each press, or only switching while you hold the button."
"You can set the interval for the avoidance action using ([W]/[A]/[S]/[D]) movement keys on the keyboard."
"Set whether the radar will rotate to follow the camera's orientation."
"While the radar map is magnified, you can temporarily change the magnification settings when an E-trial occurs."
"Choose whether to display selected Subpalette entry."
"Configure pet HP bar and status icon appearance."
"Select whether to show other party's names as blue or white"
"The color displayed of the HP bar when hit with Strike, Ranged or Tech damage."

"Set whether or not to display an icon for players in need of revival.
※You can still receive bonuses even if the icon is not displayed."
"Set the initial cursor position when the Storage UI is displayed. Applies to opening Storage, to putting items up for sale in your My Shop and to buying and selling items at NPC shops."
"Set whether to display simple Gathering information on the main menu."
"Changes how the Character Menu is displayed when selecting others."
"Configure how the Quest Counter is displayed"
"Sets the display format of the Party Menu."

"Set whether to save the party settings, even after logging out and changing blocks.
The party setting will be saved until you exit the game."

"Set the default party name (if no party name is set).
Can be set to the Party Leader's Character Name or the name of the Quest."

"Set what the cursor's default position is when choosing between same-block and multi-block matching.
※Some Quests are excluded."
"Set whether or not to automatically pick up Meseta when it is nearby."
"When 13★ or higher items drop, this setting will deposit them directly to your Inventory instead of in the field to protect against forgotten drops."
"When 12★ or higher units drop, this setting will deposit them directly to your Inventory instead of in the field to protect against forgotten drops."
"When Order Items/Material Items drop, this setting will deposit them directly to your Material Storage instead of in the field."
"When items other than weapons, units and materials drop, this setting will deposit them directly to your Inventory instead of in the field to protect against forgotten drops."
"Select the rarity at which rare drop notifications will appear upon a rare item dropping."
"Set whether or not to draw attention to events by prompting you to hold <%Access>."

"Enable or disable the video playback in-game (such as on the monitors in the ARKS Lobby).
※Requires a restart to take effect."
"Autoselects beginner blocks or random blocks when using a Lv.20↓ character."

"Set how many Photon Blasts to display.
Displaying fewer will ease processing."
"When using the mouse, choose whether to prioritize the camera or the mouse cursor."
"Configure how EXP and Damage indicators are displayed."
"Configure how HP Recovery and Damage Taken indicators are displayed."
"Configure the display text size of when you earn EXP."
"Enable or disable the window when a Party Invitation is received."
"Enable or disable the window when a Friend Request is received."
"Enable or disable the window when a Team Invitation is received."
"Enable or disable the window when a Group Invitation is received."
"Enable or disable the window when a Trade Request is received."
"Set whether to display the Recommended Orders window when starting a Featured Quest."
"Enable or disable the confirmation window when the party leader starts a multi-block quest"
"Set whether to offer to repair important button assignments if a problem is detected."
"Set whether to display multiple notification messages or only one."
"Set whether to log a notification upon receiving an item."
"Configure whether or not a notification is displayed when a party member collects a rare item."
"Set whether to display a notification at login when your Premium Set is 7 days away from expiring."
"When you log in, send Login Call to friends."

"Choose whether to display indicators for incapacitated party members.
Does not apply to Friend/Support/Free Partners."

"Choose whether to allow other players to see an indicator if you are incapacitated.
If a player has this setting turned off, you will not receive the indicator."

"If enabled, all keyboard buttons will only be used for chat.
※[ScrollLock] will change this setting at any time."

"Turn off the ability for the Scroll Lock key to toggle direct chat.

If direct chat is not working properly, try turning ON this setting - There's a possibility that will fix it."
"Set whether to quote mail in replies."
"Select whether to show or hide Symbol Arts."
"Set the conditions for team chat display."
"Change how Group Chat Balloons are displayed."
"Set whether to display the Player ID name or the Character name in Group Chat, Team Chat and Whispers."
"Sets whether chat background color changes based on who you're talking to."
"Set whether to automatically block Group Chat invites."
"If you have Autowords set, choosing \"Disable\" will prevent them from triggering."
"Set whether to show Autowords in the chatlog."
"ログを表示する順序を設定します。"
"Filters the type of Autowords are allowed to be displayed on the screen."
"Filters the type of Chat that is allowed to be shown under the Show All display tab in the Log Window."
"Select the format to use for screenshots."

"Set whether to show the interface (including windows) in screenshots.

"Set whether to show the interface (including windows) in screenshots.

"Set whether you want your Casts' human and robotic bodies to share the same proportions, or whether you want to edit them separately.

Humanoid-type and Cast bodies are synchronized by default. However, you can individually edit them by selecting \"Separate Physique Editing\"."

"Select your Rideroid settings.

Manual Type: Fully manual drive.
Auto Type: Fully automatic drive.

"Set the camera's horizontal rotation direction when on a Rideroid."
"Set the camera's vertical rotation direction when on a Rideroid."
"Set which direction the Rideroid turns horizontally."
"Set which direction the Rideroid moves vertically."
"During Dark Blast, you can set a dedicated voice."

"Change other players' Dark Blast display type.

[Other player's choice]
Syncs Dark Blasts settings with how other players set theirs.

[Always display as Aura type]
Other players' Dark Blasts will always appear as Dark Blast Auras.

[Display characters only]
Only displays their character model instead of their Dark Blast.

Only applies when \"Drawing/Shader Quality\" is set to \"High Quality\"."
